intro: Psychotria amita, commonly known as the "little psychotria," is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Mexico and Brazil. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy green surface with prominent veins. Psychotria amita produces small, white or pale yellow flowers clustered in inflorescences, which are often accompanied by attractive red bracts.
